Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.message:
question mark folder , no water damage, i was try good know ssd but the same.. and do not show on disk utility.

but now it wont work anymore.

threads.title: 820-00480 not recognize ssd
threads.message: Then should be some problem on the board, or SSD connector.

threads.title: 820-00480 not recognize ssd
threads.message:
First you should check if the machine is affected by [URL]https://support.apple.com/13-inch-macbook-pro-solid-state-drive-service[/URL]

About compatibility between 2016/2017:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://beetstech.com/blog/apple-proprietary-ssd-ultimate-guide-to-specs-and-upgrades[/URL]
[QUOTE]After extensive testing with every Gen. 5A drive we could get our hands on, it appears that 128GB SSDs with part numbers beginning with 656-0074 and 256GB SSDs with part numbers beginning with 656-0076 are only compatible with the model A1708 laptops from the Mid 2017 release.[/QUOTE]
820-00840 being the 2017 model, it shouldn't be a problem.
Note that the SSD_BOOT_L/SSD_PWR_EN_L circuit is different between 820-00875 (2016) and 820-00840 (2017). Only the schematics for 820-00875 is available, in this one U8640/R8645 are populated while R8641/R8642 are not. On the 820-00840 it's the opposite.

threads.title: 820-00480 not recognize ssd
threads.message: thanks for that, i do have 820-00840 scheme and boardview, im also put good ssd from the same board number (2017) but it not recognized it to.

threads.title: 820-00480 not recognize ssd
threads.message:
First check L8600/02.
Next check input and output levels for U8640.
Also need to know SSD_RESET_L and SSD_CLKREQ_L levels.
SSD_EN goes high?

threads.title: 820-00480 not recognize ssd
threads.message:
L8600:
1.PP3V3_SSD_FLT -0V
2.PP3V3_S5_SSD_SNS-3.3V

L8602:
1.PPBUS_SSD_FLT 0V
2. PPBUS_G3H_SSD - 13V


U8640:
pp1v8_s5g -1.8v stable
all the rest 1.8v-0v pulsing at the beginning and then 0v.

SSD_RESET_L - 3.3V
SSD_CLKREQ_L - 3.3V
SSD_EN 3.3V
